page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {HEXHAM ABBEY The Abbey was built in 1180 and it was burned down by Scottish tribes and other people.It has been built again and again.It was knocked down in about 1200 and rebuilt shortly after,but parts were not restored until 1907.The graveyard holds some famous people. The south Transept,which was ten years earlier than the graveyard.It is smaller but of equally fine proportion.Acca's cross faces an even older monument.In a blocked doorway at the foot of the night stairs stands a roman stone from Corbridge.The Abbeys clock has Roman numerals on it.The clock has probably been knocked down as much as the Abbey.There is a shop just outside the Abbey,it sells monuments ofthe Abbey,and other things.
